etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Freeman's Journal. From grandstand + -er

definitions: A person who occupies a seat in a grandstand.

notes.text: In early use also hyphenated or as two separate words.

definitions: A player who appears to seek the approval of the spectators rather than concentrating on the playing of the game; (in extended use) a person whose words or actions are motivated primarily by the desire to attract attention or gain approval.
